It has been a couple of years since they approved me and the letter said they follow up every couple of years. In the paperwork it asked for three people that they can call to talk about my diagnosis. You couldn't put down your doctors though. I am just curious if anyone is going through this paperwork and if they called your family/friends and what do they ask them?! "Is she dead yet?!" I feel like they would probably prefer me to be that way. The hardest thing about living with stage 4 cancer is they don't get the depths of our pain, fatigue, depression, etc. all from this stupid disease. Posts.Content: smiley2 wrote: Hi amazing and strong ladies, First time to this discussion board.  I have stage 4 BC so they put me on Zometa, Zolodex and Femara.  I have been having blood in my urine and edema and now I feel like my kidneys kind of hurt or there is a dull discomfort..  My oncologist told me that these weren't side effects to Femara.  Then my husband and I look up on internet and there it says that Zoladex and Femara cause blood in urine and edema!  I am just curious if ANYONE has had this side effect?  Scan in January was stable, went and had ultrasount/sonogram at Gyno's office and that came back ok and normal.  WTF is going on?!  Obviously one of these drugs is really doing some damage or the mets has spread but it isn't showing up on any scans yet?  My mind is going crazy and I am so annoyed and pissed at how I feel like WE are the ones that are the doctors half the time!  Do they ever listen?!  There wasn't even any mention of "maybe we should take you off this drug for a little bit and see if that helps?"  Any insight or advice would be much appreciated! Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2012 08:52AM smiley2 wrote: I maybe didn't communicate it effictively in my first post but what I was also trying to say is that her portrayal of "I just want to get on with my life, have a baby and live happily ever after" is like putting your head in the sand after a cancer diagnosis.  Being stage 4 now but stage 2 earlier...what I have learned is you can't hide your head in the sand and you really do need to be PROACTIVE and not be in denial.  She is probably doing juices, exercise, etc now.  She certainly doesn't need to lose any weight. But I have seen and known many gals that are stage 0 and stage 1 and end up stage 4.  You assume you would never be stage 4 because you just have this "litte tiny breast cancer" and doctors even tell you that you will be fine.  But cancer is sneaky.  So for Guliana to act like she is just going to get on with life.....I don't think she is sending a good message.  And that isn't to say you should live your life after a diagnosis focusing only on breast cancer because God knows we all need a break from this disease and isn't it a great day when you can go a day, an hour or a minute without thinking about his disease.  But just the fact that she just wants to shove it out of her existance..... And I get the issue of having a baby.  I was stubborn and was determined to have more kids.  Maybe if I realized the severity of even a stage 2 breast cancer diagnosis and went all out on shutting down hormones and having ovaries out,  etc....mabye I wouldn't be in this stage today.  Bottom line, I would do so many things differently if I could go back to my stage 2 diagnosis and I just hope she is doing something rather than assuming "I am just stage 0 or stage 1"....nothing to worry about!
Posts.Title: Celebrities and BC smiley2 DivineMrsM

Posts.Content: smiley2 wrote: Do any of you watch Guliana and Bill on E?  I watched the season finale and I was a little surprised.  She asked her doctor if he had ever seen her cancer before and he said it isn't as common but he has treated a few women and they are all doing fine.  And since she is now taking Tamoxifen obviously her cancer was hormone positive but then the doctor said something about Her2.  I am not Her2 positive but there was no mention of Herceptin.  Isn't that a MUST to take when you are Her2 positive?!  And then she had another egg retrieval which surprised me as well that an oncologist would even allow that considering her cancer is hormone positive?  I was told I couldn't do any kind of egg retrieval b/c the drugs to get the eggs pump you full of hormones and that would feed the cancer even more.  They also said the cancer even though early stage is slightly invasive with "40-60 cells" so guessing she had a sentinal node that showed up positive. But the doctor made it seem like no big deal!  If you ask Dr. Block in Chicago, he would tell you that anyone with a cancer diagnosis whether you are stage 0, 1, 2 or 3....you assume that there is a cancer cell that got out and is in bloodstream.  It just takes one to get out and wreak havok!  I know this show is just for entertainment but I almost think this girl needs to be shaken!  She doesn't seem to get the severity of a cancer diagnosis!  And her husbnd told her to stay away from all of these discussion boards!  To only listen to doctors!  What an idiot!  If he only knew how much great information is on these boards!  If his doctor hasn't even mentioned Herceptin to his wife...he isn't getting "the best" treatment plan for his wife that is for sure! Even though it isn't reality TV, I also watch The Big C on Showtime with Laura Linney!  Love her F*** it attitude! Stage 4; 2/16 nodes; ER+/PR+; Her2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: smiley2 wrote: I am curious for those of you that have been taking Zoladex for at least 5-6 years....have you noticed gut issues? My scans are stable. And has anyone's stomach gotten larger since taking Zoladex? Granted, I don't exercise like I should and I think I may have a hernia but I pointed it out to my doctor and she said "oh yes, I have a lot of patients who's stomachs got bigger on Zoladex." I am sure part of this might be menopause as well? But the more I think about it, shot after shot after shot in my stomach every month is probably also causing a lot of scar tissue (I get double shot because I got the Lidocaine too) and with all those chemicals going directly into our stomach/gut/digestive system …..it has had to affect it, wouldn't you think?  Just curious if anyone else has the belly and your thoughts on gut issues...not absorbing nutrients properly?! etc etc? Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2014 08:09PM smiley2 wrote: Hi CJRT, I have gone a few times with not getting it at exactly 28 days.  I have postponed it due to flu or not feeling well, snow, bad weather, etc.  I don't sweat it.  That shit is in our bodies and being on it for 5 1/2 years, I don't think my ovaries are going to immediately awaken if I miss a week or so!  Those things are probably in a coma by now!  I would go enjoy your vacation and just schedule your shot for when you get back! I think I saw on this site somewhere that there are some girls that are doing it every other month!?  But I do think that is very interesting that you have the swollen lower leg too!  I went to see another doctor today to get an order for my lymphadema lady to start treating it.  She thinks I have "subclinical lymphedema".  It is very minor swelling and you wouldn't even notice a difference in my legs but I can FEEL the difference.  Do you have any feelings of fullness, tightness or fuzzy feeling sometimes? I think it is ridiculous that these doctors say that it can't be the medication...it says in the package insert under side effects (I think "rare") that it causes "LOWER LEG EDEMA".  Zoladex and Femara BOTH say it in their PI's and I am on both drugs.  Someone has to be the 1-3% right?!  I swear these doctors don't even know what the hell is printed in these package inserts!
